headline.print_headline: Trial Centers on Whether New Jersey Man Who Admired ISIS Tried to Join Group
headline.main: Trial Opens for Air Force Veteran Accused of Trying to Join ISIS

snippet: An airplane mechanic from New Jersey known among colleagues for his vocal support for the Islamic State is charged with planning to support the group, after flying to Turkey....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

abstract: Terrorism trial of Tairod Pugh, New Jersey native and Muslim convert suspected of sympathizing with Islamic extremest groups after working as American contractor across Middle East, centers on whether he took steps to join Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: An airplane mechanic from New Jersey known among colleagues for his vocal support for the Islamic State is charged with planning to support the group, after flying to Turkey.

headline.print_headline: Release of Basque Leader May Lift Separatist Cause
headline.main: Hope and Fear Await a Basque Leader on His Release From Prison

snippet: The release of Arnaldo Otegi — jailed for his ties to an outlawed political party — and what it might mean for the Basque cause is raising alarm in Spain....

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

abstract: Spanish Supreme Court's decision to release Basque separatist leader Arnaldo Otegi, after pressure from human rights activists, troubles Spanish authorities already wary of political gridlock and Catalan separatist movement; controversial figure linked to violent militant group ETA promises to resume political activism.
lead_paragraph: The release of Arnaldo Otegi — jailed for his ties to an outlawed political party — and what it might mean for the Basque cause is raising alarm in Spain.

headline.print_headline: Middle East; Iraq: ISIS Attacks Hit Baghdad

snippet: Suicide bombers hit a Shiite religious building and a military checkpoint in Baghdad on Thursday, killing 15 people and wounding 48....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Islamic State group claims responsibility for suicide bombings in Shiite-majority neighborhood in Baghdad that killed 15 and wounded 48.
lead_paragraph: Suicide bombers hit a Shiite religious building and a military checkpoint in Baghdad on Thursday, killing 15 people and wounding 48.

headline.print_headline: Washington: Gun Charges for Man Said to Back Isis
headline.main: Washington: Gun Charges for Man Said to Back Isis

snippet: An Army deserter who called Osama bin Laden “a beautiful man,” made statements supporting the Islamic State group and called for the death of American troops has been charged with illegally possessing firearms....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Army deserter Daniel Seth Franey is charged with five counts of unlawful gun possession in Tacoma, Wash, for making what he believed were black-market gun deliveries; had made comments in support of Islamic State and was barred from having guns in light of protection order taken out by his former partner.
lead_paragraph: An Army deserter who called Osama bin Laden “a beautiful man,” made statements supporting the Islamic State group and called for the death of American troops has been charged with illegally possessing firearms.

headline.main: Gunmen Attack Bacha Khan University in Pakistan

snippet: The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, whose victims were said to include students, a senior faculty member and four guards....
lead_paragraph: The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, whose victims were said to include students, a senior faculty member and four guards.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Belgium: Rumors of Orgy Are Unfounded, Police Say
headline.main: Report of Orgy at Brussels Police Station Is Unfounded, Officials Say

snippet: The rumors of debauchery were started by disgruntled female officers who had not been invited to a party with soldiers at the station, officials said....
abstract: Brussels police say investigation has found no credibility in reports of orgy involving two female officers and group of Belgian soldiers on night when city was on high alert for terrorist attack.
lead_paragraph: The rumors of debauchery were started by disgruntled female officers who had not been invited to a party with soldiers at the station, officials said.

headline.print_headline: Officer Is Cleared in the Death of a Mall Attacker in Minnesota
headline.main: Minnesota Mall Attacker’s Killing by Police Was Justified, Prosecutors Say

snippet: Security footage showed Dahir Adan advancing toward an off-duty police officer in a premeditated attack, probably prompted by his radicalization....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Prosecutors clear Minnesota Police Officer Jason Falconer of wrongdoing in shooting of Dahir Adan, man who carried out stabbing rampage at mall in St Cloud, Minn, in September; investigators remain uncertain of Adan's motives and whether he had ties to Islamic State or other extremists.
lead_paragraph: Security footage showed Dahir Adan advancing toward an off-duty police officer in a premeditated attack, probably prompted by his radicalization.

headline.print_headline: Attack Suspect Carried Writings  Endorsing Jihad
headline.main: Ahmad Khan Rahami Was Inspired by Bin Laden, Charges Say

snippet: One day after Mr. Rahami, the suspect in the Manhattan and New Jersey bombings, was taken into custody, investigators on Tuesday were learning more about what might have motivated the attack....
abstract: Chelsea bomber Ahmad Khan Rahami is charged in federal court with crimes including use of weapons of mass destruction and bombing place of public use; complaint states Rahami was motivated by extremist Islamic ideology that was recorded in notebook found when he was captured by police; charges come day after disclosure that Rahami's father in 2014 told FBI that his son was terrorist, prompting review that found no grounds for further inquiry.
lead_paragraph: One day after Mr. Rahami, the suspect in the Manhattan and New Jersey bombings, was taken into custody, investigators on Tuesday were learning more about what might have motivated the attack.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rukmini Callimachi, Annie Correal, Elizabeth A. Harris, Joseph Goldstein, Sarah Maslin Nir, Julia Preston, William K. Rashbaum, Rick Rojas, Eli Rosenberg, Nate Schweber, Scott Shane and Benjamin Weiser.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and ADAM GOLDMAN

snippet: Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28, was arrested in connection with explosions in New York and New Jersey over the weekend. Neighbors described him as a friendly car enthusiast and were surprised by the arrest....
lead_paragraph: Ahmad Khan Rahami, 28, was arrested in connection with explosions in New York and New Jersey over the weekend. Neighbors described him as a friendly car enthusiast and were surprised by the arrest.

byline.original: By YOUSUR AL-HLOU, SHANE O'NEILL and MEGAN SPECIA
